review_title: Working for the J before UPMC take over
job_title: Nuring Payroll Coordinator in New Castle, PA
pros: My supervisors were fair. My pay grade was raised by my last supervisor and I was allowed to use flex time due to attending college. Benefits were good and affordable.
cons: Not all managers follow the rules, policies,procedures for all employees. Favoritism but not in my dept. My dept was small.  Years ago working there was fun. I got a  BS not in nursing and the dept I got my BS in wouldn't hire me and I was employed there 22 years.  That was very wrong. That manager has mover on thank goodness.

review_title: Hospital culture makes life difficult for low-ranking positions
job_title: Nursing Assistant in New Castle, PA
pros: None, really. Typically, I would suggest that being able to participate in patient care, and seeing their respective recuperation first-hand, can make working in health-care a rewarding experience. Not here, though. The patients feel as entitled and self-righteous a most of the staff themselves.
cons: As a nursing assistant, there is a culture perpetuated by the hospital that it is okay to micromanage excessively. Anything that one is safely 'allowed' to do (i.e. covered by insurance as being capable of providing such treatment) will be assigned to the lowest man on the totem pole.

job_title: Supply Specialist in New Castle, PA
pros: Easy hours, friendly staff, everybody trying to get along and help those who need to get well
cons: Managers at the time thinking they know better and trying to pound their chest's say look at me, I AM THE BOSS!

job_title: Registered Nurse in New Castle, PA
pros: Team work amongst coworkers. Depending on the shift everyone treats each other fairly and genuinely wants to help care for the patients.
cons: Negativity from supervisors and upper management. The respect for the staff is minimal. You do not feel important but easily replaceable

job_title: Registered Nurse in New Castle, PA
pros: Location to community, some people employees care, no commitment to hard working employees
cons: reactive never pro-active, management, lack of policy enforcement, poor doctors

job_title: Staff RN in New Castle, PA
pros: flexible, always had needs to fill for extra hours
cons: poor management, lack of support for floor stavv
